newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: India seeks 30,000 tonnes of April 26-30 fuel oil.
newsitem.headline: India seeks 30,000 tonnes of April 26-30 fuel oil.

text.p: State-owned Indian Oil Corp (IOC) has issued a tender to buy 30,000 tonnes of 3.5-percent sulphur fuel oil for delivery in late April, industry sources said on Tuesday.
IOC seeks to buy the cargo for delivery April 26-30 to Bombay, the sources said.
In its last fuel oil tender, IOC bought two 30,000-tonne 3.5-percent high sulphur fuel oil cargoes for April delivery.
One cargo was bought at $6 per tonne above spot MiddleEast quotes on a free-on-board basis and the other at $12.5 per tonne on a c-and-f basis, also above spot MiddleEast prices.
